ol.li: Employees who use hand and power tools and are exposed to the hazards of falling, flying, abrasive, and splashing objects, or to harmful dusts, fumes, mists, vapors, or gases shall be provided with the appropriate personal protective equipment.
All electrical connections for these tools shall be suitable for the type of tool and the working conditions (wet, dusty, flammable vapors).
When a temporary power source is used for construction, a ground-fault circuit interrupter shall be used.
Employees shall be trained in the proper use of all tools to include: recognizing the hazards associated with the different types of tools and the safety precautions necessary.
